Copyright ©  Kindie Biredagn Nahato et al. is is an open access article distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution
License, which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided the original work is properly cited.
e availability of clinical datasets and knowledge mining methodologies encourages the researchers to pursue research in
extracting knowledge from clinical datasets. Dierent data mining techniques have been used for mining rules, and mathematical
models have been developed to assist the clinician in decision making. e objective of this research is to build a classier that
will predict the presence or absence of a disease by learning from the minimal set of attributes that has been extracted from the
clinical dataset. In this work rough set indiscernibility relation method with backpropagation neural network (RS-BPNN) is used.
is work has two stages. e rst stage is handling of missing values to obtain a smooth data set and selection of appropriate
attributes from the clinical dataset by indiscernibility relation method. e second stage is classication using backpropagation
neural network on the selected reducts of the dataset. e classier has been tested with hepatitis, Wisconsin breast cancer, and
Statlog heart disease datasets obtained from the University of California at Irvine (UCI) machine learning repository. e accuracy
obtained from the proposed method is .%, .%, and .% for hepatitis, breast cancer, and heart disease, respectively. e
proposed system provides an eective classication model for clinical datasets.
In this information era the advancement of computerized
database system facilitates the enhancement of decision
making and diagnosis in medical science. Analysis of clinical
datasets by using data mining methodology, techniques, and
tools helps to develop a knowledge based system that can
assist clinicians in decision making [, ]. Clinical dataset
consists of information about the current condition of the
patients []. e information includes data of patient prole,
physical checkup, and laboratory results. Mining knowledge
from clinical dataset refers to the discovery of hidden valuable
knowledge, to develop clinical expert system [, ].
Knowledge mining methodology applied on the clinical
dataset depends on the type of dataset and the purpose to
attain the desired objective. e major data mining function-
alities are association rule mining, classication, and clus-
tering []. Association rule discovers interesting relationship
among the attributes. e interestingness of the relation is
measured using two metrics, namely, support and condence
[, ]. Classication is applied on a dataset which has a
predened class. Classication process learns from a set of
attributes that include decision attribute to decide the class
label. e learning process is done by a learning algorithm
applied over a training dataset, whereas the performance of
learning is evaluated using performance measures over the
testing dataset []. Clustering is performed on a dataset to
categorize it into a group by maximizing the similarity and
minimizing the dierence in a group. e learning technique
used in classication is supervised whereas in clustering it is
unsupervised [, ].
In this work a classier that predicts the presence or
absence of a disease using rough set indiscernibility relation
method and backpropagation learning algorithm is devel-
oped.
Rough set theory, proposed by Pawlak during s, deals
with uncertainty, vagueness, imprecision, and incomplete
information [–] for feature selection, feature reduction,
and extraction of decision rule from the given dataset.
Indiscernibility relation method of rough set theory is used
Hindawi Publishing Corporation
Computational and Mathematical Methods in Medicine
Volume 2015, Article ID 460189, 13 pages
 Computational and Mathematical Methods in Medicine
to select minimal representative subset of the attributes
fromthedataset.eselectedattributesareusedasinputs
to the backpropagation neural network learning process.
Backpropagation(BP)methodiscommonlyusedinarticial
neural network (ANN) model proposed by Rumelharth [,
]. Backpropagation neural network (BPNN) consists of
three types of layers, namely, input layer, one or more hidden
layers, and output layer [, ]. BPNN has to perform three
tasks, namely, feedforward from input layer to output layer,
computeandbackpropagatetheerror,andupdatetheweights
from output layer to input layer [, ].
e proposed technique has been applied on three dier-
ent clinical datasets obtained from University of California at
Irvine (UCI) machine learning repository. ese datasets are
hepatitis, Wisconsin breast cancer, and Statlog heart disease
dataset [].
Hepatitis refers to inammation of the largest internal
humanorgan,liver,causedbyviralinfection.ehepatitis
viruscanbegroupedasA,B,C,D,andE.esevirusescause
acute to chronic disease; type B and type C, especially, lead to
chronic diseases.
Cancer is a major cause for high mortality globally.
According to World Health Organization (WHO) statistics,
half a billion women died in  due to breast cancer. e
uncontrolled growth of cells creates mass of tissue called
tumor. e tumor can be categorized as benign (not can-
cerous) and malignant (cancer). Breast cancer caused by a
malignant tumor develops in the cells of breast.
Cardiovascular disease (CVD), which aects the heart,
blood vessels, and circulation of blood throughout the body,
isoneoftheleadingcausesofdeath.AsstatedbyWHO,about
millionpeople(%ofglobaldeath)diedindueto
CVD and this number will increase to  million in the next
one and half decades.
e rest of the paper is organized as follows. Section 
explains the related work carried out by other researchers and
highlights the signicance of this work. System architecture
of the proposed work is discussed in Section . Experimental
results are discussed in Section . Conclusion and scope for
future work are mentioned in Section .
Shao et al. []intheirworkhaveproposedahybrid
intelligent modeling system for heart disease classication.
e dataset used by the researchers consists of  patients’
records with  attributes. ey have used instance elimi-
nation method for handling missing values. Aer removal
of records with missing values, the dataset reduces to 
records. e researchers have used single stage modeling,
namely, logistic regression (LR), multivariate adaptive regres-
sion splines (MARS), rough sets (RS), and articial neural
network (ANN). e researchers have applied backprop-
agation network (BPNN) for ANN structure. e hybrid
intelligent models used in their work are LR-ANN, MARS-
ANN, RS-ANN, LR-MARS, RS-MARS, LR-RS, MARS-RS,
MARS-LR,andRS-LR.eresearchershaveachievedan
accuracy of .% for the MARS-LR hybrid intelligent
model with six attributes. It can be inferred from their work
thattheaccuracyofhybridmodelsishigherthansinglestage
models.
Kaya and Uyar []intheirworkdevelopedhybriddeci-
sion support system based on rough set and extreme learning
machine for diagnosis of hepatitis disease. ey have used
hepatitis disease dataset from UCI repository. e authors
produce  reducts with a range of three to seven attributes
using rough set. e reducts are selected before removing the
missing value. e records with missing value are removed
from each reduct. Classication is done by means of extreme
learning machine. e researchers have obtained % accu-
racy with the reduct of four attributes (fatigue, malaise,
protime, and histology) with the division of –% for
training-testing. e selected reduct holds only  records.
Sartakhti et al. [] have designed a hybrid system of
support vector machine and simulated annealing (SVM-SA)
for detecting hepatitis disease. e researchers have taken the
dataset from UCI repository. By removing the missing value,
the researchers have reduced the size of the dataset to  sam-
ples. e class label “Die” has  samples and the remaining
 samples are from the class “Live.” To avoid the numerical
dierences, the researchers have normalized the dataset. e
SVM-SA method is applied with -fold cross validation
procedure and tuned parameters are used for enhancing the
classication accuracy. ey achieved accuracy of .%.
By using weighted fuzzy rule, Anooj []hasdeveloped
heart disease risk prediction technique. e researcher has
used three heart disease datasets from the UCI repository,
namely, Cleveland data, Hungarian data, and Switzerland
data.eresearcherhasappliedpreprocessingstagefor
removing missing values and other noisy information from
theselecteddataset.eresearcherhasgroupedtheinstances
basedontheclasslabelandthenchangednumericaldata
type to categorical based on equi-width technique. Aer
discretization, the researcher has selected attributes for the
fuzzy rule base, based on the occurrence of the attribute value
in each class. e weighted fuzzy rule is applied to Mamdani
fuzzy inference system. Accuracy (training-testing) of the
generated IF-THEN rule has become .–., .–., and
.–. for Cleveland, Hungarian, and Switzerland dataset,
respectively.
Chen et al. [] have built automatic diagnostic system by
using support vector machine (SVM) with rough set based
feature selection. It is tested using Wisconsin breast cancer
dataset. e researcher discarded  records due to their
missing value. Aer removal of missing value, the dataset
consists of  samples belonging to benign class and 
samples to malignant class. ey produce  reducts by using
genetic algorithm based rough set approach. Seven reducts
have been selected for further classication process. Before
classication, the researchers have normalized the dataset
to the range of [−1,1].eyhaveperformed-foldcross
validation with the data division of %, %, and % train-
ing datasets. e researchers have ne-tuned the parameter
of SVM to obtain higher accuracy. With the reduct of ve
attributes, the researchers have achieved % accuracy.
Marcano-Cede
no et al. [] proposed breast cancer
classication method by using articial metaplasticity multi-
layer perceptron (AMMLP). e researchers have used UCI
Computational and Mathematical Methods in Medicine 
Wisconsin breast cancer dataset. By removing the sample
with missing value, the remaining  samples are taken for
further analysis. eir proposed network is trained by % of
the dataset, that is,  samples. e remaining  samples
are used for testing. eir proposed AMMLP has a single
hidden layer with eight neurons. ey used two criteria to
stop the training process. e rst one is if the mean squared
error is approached to . and the other one is by xing the
training epochs to . eir classier achieves accuracy of
Chen et al. []appliedahybridoflocalFisherdiscrim-
inant analysis (LFDA) and support vector machines (SVM)
for hepatitis disease prediction. e proposed system was
implemented on hepatitis dataset from UCI. e researchers
imputedallthemissingvaluesandthennormalizedthe
dataset between an interval of [0, 1].eyhavereducedthe
dimension of the data from  to  components by using
LFDA. e researchers distribute the dataset to training-
testing partition of (–%, –%, and -%) by
stratied sampling techniques. ey have used the SVM
classier with -fold cross validation. e researchers ne-
tuned the two parameters of SVM: regularization () and
kernel function parameter () to . and , respectively. ey
have achieved .% accuracy with the data division of –
% for training-testing. In their study, the researchers have
imputed the attribute with more than % of missing value
attributes.
C¸alis¸ir and Dogantekin [] proposed an intelligent sys-
tem using principal component analysis (PCA) and least
square support vector machine (LSSVM). e proposed
method is applied on hepatitis dataset from UCI. e
researchers have reduced the dimension to  using PCA.
eir classier, LSSVM, includes two parameters: the width
of Gaussian kernel () and regularization factor ().ey
have obtained accuracy of .% with a ne-tuned value
of . and  for  and ,respectively.eirproposed
method did not explain whether the missing value is rejected
or imputed.
Vijaya et al. [] developed an intelligent model by using
fuzzy neurogenetic approach for predicting the severity of
cardiovascular disease. eir proposed method was tested
on Cleveland heart disease dataset from UCI repository.
e researchers have used trapezoidal membership function
for fuzzication process. eir architecture holds , ,
and  neurons in the input layer, hidden layer, and output
layer, respectively. Sigmoidal activation function has been
applied for both hidden layer and output layer neurons. ey
have selected the weight associated between nodes based on
the best tness value of the chromosome by using genetic
algorithm. eir system produced IF...THEN rules with an
accuracy of %.
Dogantekin et al. []haveproposeddiagnosissystem
based on linear discriminant analysis and adaptive network
based on fuzzy inference system (LDA-ANFIS). ey applied
the proposed system on hepatitis dataset from UCI reposi-
tory. By using LDA, the researchers have extracted  features
fromthedataset.eyimputedallthemissingvalueinthe
records. In their experiment  and  samples were assigned
to training and testing dataset respectively. eir proposed
ANFIS classier comprises  layers, bell-shaped membership
function, and  rules. e mean square error (MSE) and
number of epochs are . and , respectively. With the
mentioned MSE and epochs, the researchers have achieved
accuracy of .%.
Karabatak and Ince [] developed a breast cancer detec-
tion system using association rules (AR) and neural network
(NN). e dataset used for this study is taken from UCI. e
researchers have used two dierent techniques of AR, AR
and AR, to reduce the features of the dataset. AR feature
selection eliminates the attributes if it depends on others
with threshold value of support and condence, whereas AR
selects the frequent attributes in each class. By using AR
method they reduced the feature size to eight from nine. e
AR method selects four attributes based on their frequency.
In their study, both ARNN and ARNN have  and  neuron
in their hidden and output layer respectively. e activation
functions selected by the researchers are tangent sigmoid
and linear for hidden and output layer, respectively. ey
have used Levenberg-Marquardt backpropagation learning
rule and MSE of .. ey have achieved accuracy of .%
with AR reducts.
Kahramanli and Allahverdi []proposedahybridneu-
ral network system by integrating articial neural network
(ANN) and fuzzy neural network (FNN) to diagnose diabetes
and heart disease. e two datasets, namely, Pima Indian
diabetes and Cleveland heart disease dataset, are taken from
UCI machine learning repository. Missing value for heart
disease is imputed by the mean value of the attribute to which
the tuple class belongs. e researcher used two separate
phases (FNN and ANN) and one more phase (ANN) by
using the output of the two phases as input. ey have used
triangular membership function and maximum defuzzier
for FNN phase. Crisp value is taken as input and sigmoid
activation function is applied for both hidden and output
layers for ANN backpropagation phase. e output of the rst
two phases becomes input for ANN. eir proposed system
achieved accuracy of % and % for diabetes and heart
disease dataset, respectively.
Compared to the work discussed in the literature, the
proposed system is dierent in the following ways: rst, the
system handles the missing values of the dataset by reject-
ing or imputing records. If the quantum of missing value
is greater than twenty-ve percent, the system rejects the
record, else the system imputes by the most frequent value of
the attribute belonging to the same class label of the record.
Aer handling the missing value, dimension reduction is per-
formed by using rough set indiscernibility method. Selected
reducts are given as input to the articial neural network for
classication.
e architecture of the proposed system is shown in Figure .
3.1. Dataset Description. For this study three clinical datasets
have been selected from the UCI machine learning repos-
itory. ese are hepatitis dataset, Wisconsin breast cancer
dataset, and Statlog heart disease dataset. Hepatitis dataset

consists of  samples with  case attributes and a class label.
e class label predicts whether the patient with hepatitis will
live or not. e dataset has  “Die” and  “Live” instances.
Table  describes the attributes of the hepatitis dataset.
e Wisconsin breast cancer dataset identies whether
the patient’s breast tissue is malignant or benign. Benign
class has  (.%) records and malignant class holds 
(.%)records.Aerexcludingthesamplecodenumber,
the dataset consists of nine features and a class attribute. All
attributes have a data type of integer value ranging from  to
. It holds  samples with missing value. All the missing
values belong to the attribute of bare nucleoli. Table  briefs

e third clinical dataset for this study is the Statlog heart
disease. is dataset has  samples with  features and a
class attribute. ere are no missing values in this dataset. A
description of the dataset is given in Table .
3.2. Handling Missing Value. Handling of missing values is
adatapreprocessingtechniquetoobtainasmoothdataset.
e common methods include ignoring the tuple that holds
missing value, imputing with the mean, or imputing with the
most frequent value []. Hepatitis and breast cancer dataset
have missing values but not Statlog heart disease dataset.
In this study, missing value is handled as follows. If the
percentage of missing value in a tuple is greater than or equal
to %, then reject that tuple from the dataset or else impute
it by the most frequent value of the attribute in the class that
belongs to the tuple. e same applies to attributes too.
Aer handling missing values, the hepatitis dataset is
reduced to  samples with  attributes by rejecting Protime
attribute and  tuples from the dataset. For breast cancer
dataset, all the missing values are imputed by the most
frequent value of the attribute of the class label that belongs
to the tuple.
3.3. Feature Selection Using Rough Set. Feature selection
using rough set theory has been widely used in data analysis
[]. e selected subset of attributes, which has the same
equivalence relation of entire attribute, is referred to as
reduct (Red (R)) [–]. In this work, rough set theory indis-
cernibility relation method is used for feature selection.
Information System Table. Information system table is a two-
dimensional table (column and row). e row shows denite
number of objects, whereas the column shows the attribute
valueandclasslabeloftheobjects[]. It can be presented
as =(,∪)where  is nite set of objects,  is set of
attribute, and is decision (class label). Table  shows sample
of information system table based on three attributes.

is paper combines rough set theory with backpropagation
neural network to classify the clinical dataset. e proposed

algorithm is applied in three clinical datasets from UCI.
esearehepatitis,Wisconsinbreastcancer,andStatlogheart
disease datasets. e rough set theory is used to produce
minimal subset of attributes to represent the whole features of
thedataset.Fromroughsettheorytheproposedmethodused
indiscernibility relation method to select the reducts. From
hepatitis dataset indiscernibility relation method produced
 reducts with the attribute ranging from  to . From
breastcancerdiseasedatasettheproposedmethodobtained
reducts with  and  attributes. From heart disease dataset the
proposed method produced  reducts with attribute of 
to.Ninereductsandallattributesfromeachofthedatasets
are used for comparison of classication result. An articial
neural network with backpropagation learning algorithm is
used for classication. e proposed work achieves superior
performance when compared to recent and conventional
works.Itisnotalwaystruethatthereductwithlessnumber
of attributes gives highest classication accuracy. In this
study hepatitis and heart disease dataset have got their best
accuracy performance with the reduct that consists of  and
 attributes, respectively. But there were reducts with less
number of attributes in both datasets. Breast cancer dataset
obtaineditshigherperformancewithareductofleastnumber
of attributes.
e proposed method of rough set theory examines
the set of attributes for indiscernibility relation method to
obtain reducts. In future, the use of hybrid methods of rough
set theory with optimization techniques like particle swarm
optimization (PSO), ant colony optimization (ACO), genetic
algorithm (GA), and bacterial foraging (BF) can be experi-
mented with many more datasets.
